div.a: What If We Didn't Know Hurricane Sandy Was Coming?

div.div: It's no exaggeration that our ability to forecast storms saves lives and dollars every year. But what if we were no longer able to make those forecasts? Of course, it's not that we would lose the knowledge of how to do so. The problem is that we might lose the data that feeds our models.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S1iycV&via=Digg&text=What If We Didn't Know Hurricane Sandy Was Coming?

div.div: 'I SAW THIS VIDEO OF A TALKING GOAT'

div.a: Daniel Day-Lewis Talks About His Surprisingly High-Pitched Lincoln Voice

div.div: Daniel Day-Lewis and Steven Spielberg held a Q&A after a screening of Lincoln, and the question on most minds: How did he come up with that voice?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VNhVL8&via=Digg&text=Daniel Day-Lewis Talks About His Surprisingly High-Pitched Lincoln Voice

div.a: Scientists Use Cadaver Hands To Reveal The Dangers Of Pumpkin Carving

div.div: Pumpkin carving, it turns out, can be a rather dangerous pursuit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PUE7An&via=Digg&text=Scientists Use Cadaver Hands To Reveal The Dangers Of Pumpkin Carving

div.a: An Illustrated History Of James Bond's Cars

div.div: James Bond is nearly as well known for his fast cars as he is for his gadgets and beautiful Bond girls but how has his choice of motor evolved as the films have progressed?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QK0qp7&via=Digg&text=An Illustrated History Of James Bond's Cars

div.a: Drug Cartel Kingpin's Death May Make the Zetas Even Deadlier

div.div: When Mexican marines killed the leader of the Zetas earlier this month, they killed the only person capable of holding Mexico’s most dangerous cartel together. But instead of collapsing, the cartel could become even more dangerous.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TG6gML&via=Digg&text=Drug Cartel Kingpin's Death May Make the Zetas Even Deadlier

div.a: Get A Copy Of The Web

div.div: Want 80 terabytes of web-crawl? The Internet Archive will give you a copy of (an appreciable slice of) the Web, for research purposes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SbxTLB&via=Digg&text=Get A Copy Of The Web

div.a: Why Your Facebook Messages Are Way Different Now

div.div: They've been totally redesigned to be, um, chattier. And they come with a profound new side effect.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pwgn5F&via=Digg&text=Why Your Facebook Messages Are Way Different Now

div.div: The iPad maker is leading a subtle change in the tech industry which has one simple goal: getting consumers to buy more.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R5z1Ms&via=Digg&text=How Apple Keeps People Buying

div.a: Advice To Unpaid Interns: You're Being Exploited And Won't Get A Job

div.div: And only 37% of unpaid interns will get a job offer from their internship employer so why do young people continue to give up their labor for free?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PV2cXM&via=Digg&text=Advice To Unpaid Interns: You're Being Exploited And Won't Get A Job

div.div: WHAT HAVE YOU DONE WITH YOUR LIFE?

div.a: A 34-Year-Old Ex-Apple Engineer Just Bought An NBA Team

div.div: Yesterday in New York, the NBA board of governors approved the sale of the Memphis Grizzlies basketball team to a 34-year-old former Apple engineer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S1kQcz&via=Digg&text=A 34-Year-Old Ex-Apple Engineer Just Bought An NBA Team

div.div: ALTAIRS, ALTOS AND ATARIS, OH MY

div.a: Paul Allen's Living Computer Museum Opens To Public

div.div: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen was at the forefront of the personal computer revolution. And while it has been years since Allen wrote code for the company that made him a billionaire, he’s never lost his love affair with computers and it shows at his Living Computer Museum.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P6QEPE&via=Digg&text=Paul Allen's Living Computer Museum Opens To Public

div.div: WE KNOW LESS THAN WE THOUGHT

div.a: Link Between Cancer And Diet Soda Falls Into Science 'Gray Zone'

div.div: The co-author of a controversial study on diet soda's link to blood cancers says his results fall into a gray zone between a clear relationship and no relationship at all.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TDVg2q&via=Digg&text=Link Between Cancer And Diet Soda Falls Into Science 'Gray Zone'

div.a: The Raptors In 'Jurassic Park' Were So Big Because They Were Humans

div.div: As any paleontologist worth their salt has likely lamented countless times, the massive, deadly raptors portrayed in the movies are totally wrong. So what if the raptors in "Jurassic Park" were oversized because they needed to be able to fit a human inside?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QK9NVP&via=Digg&text=The Raptors In 'Jurassic Park' Were So Big Because They Were Humans

div.div: IF YOU CAN READ THIS, DON'T WORRY

div.a: Is The Internet Crashing Across America?

div.div: Don't break out your shotgun, gas mask, and emergency rations, but make sure you know where they are: it looks like an enormous chunk of the Internet in North America is dead.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PwdWQs&via=Digg&text=Is The Internet Crashing Across America?

div.div: OBAMA AND ROMNEY REALLY WANT TO KNOW

div.a: What The Undecided Voters Are Thinking

div.div: A canvasser for the Obama campaign reflects on women voters seem to be more undecided than men, the difficulty of motivating soft supporters, and why some people still haven't made up their minds at this late stage of the campaign.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pw1PD7&via=Digg&text=What The Undecided Voters Are Thinking

div.div: WHEN OWNING A JET IS JUST TOO DECADENT

div.a: Uber Co-Founder Launches BlackJet Private Plane Service

div.div: If you enjoy Uber's black-car service and want the experience the same level of luxury when travelling longer distances, BlackJet may be just the thing for you and your deep pockets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TkvVZf&via=Digg&text=Uber Co-Founder Launches BlackJet Private Plane Service

div.a: The Tree-Climbing Girl Who Turns The History Of Man On Its Head

div.div: The fragile remains of a three-year-old girl who died about 3.3 million years ago in East Africa have revealed that our early human ancestors still spent much of their time in the trees long after they had fully mastered the art of walking on two legs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sln48O&via=Digg&text=The Tree-Climbing Girl Who Turns The History Of Man On Its Head

div.a: Why Do Children Think Covering Their Eyes Makes Them Invisible?

div.div: Why do children think they can render themselves invisible? And why have nearly all young children come to this same irrational conclusion?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VMBXFo&via=Digg&text=Why Do Children Think Covering Their Eyes Makes Them Invisible?

div.a: Eerie Photographs Explore What Remains After Domestic Homicides

div.div: Long after the struggles have ended in these spaces, despite the cleaning, repainting and subsequent re-habitation of these homes, the “Blue Star” solution activates the physical memory of blood through its contact with the remaining DNA proteins on the walls.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P5LR15&via=Digg&text=Eerie Photographs Explore What Remains After Domestic Homicides

div.a: How Weibo Reacted To Wen Jiabao's Corruption

div.div: Undeterred by Chinese social media censors, users spread the New York Times' Wen expose by word of mouth, sharing screenshots, picture files or a brief summary in coded references.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SFlJYN&via=Digg&text=How Weibo Reacted To Wen Jiabao's Corruption

div.a: Why Wall Street Is Battering Tech's Biggest Names

div.div: Patience with tech companies that could do little to disappoint the market has now started to wane. So what’s going on here?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TFltO8&via=Digg&text=Why Wall Street Is Battering Tech's Biggest Names

div.a: Stealing Yachts And Planes Back From The Rich

div.div: Ken Cage and his guys make a living taking from the rich. He’s one of a handful of the world’s most sophisticated repo men. And while the language may be different from the doorbusters who grab TVs, the game is the same.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RYXVOI&via=Digg&text=Stealing Yachts And Planes Back From The Rich

div.a: James Bond Actors: How Are They Connected?

div.div: Here are the illustrated connections of actors appearing together for 23 of the Bond films including the latest, "Skyfall," released today.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WOjtnk&via=Digg&text=James Bond Actors: How Are They Connected?

div.a: Why Do We Get Baggy Eyes?

div.div: As we age, our eyes inevitably take on a baggy look. Now scientists think they know why.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QJSeFv&via=Digg&text=Why Do We Get Baggy Eyes?
